The odds of a draw closed at +340.
Belgium had 60.4% possession while Slovakia had 39.6%.
The match was held at Deutsche Bank Park in Frankfurt, Germany.
Belgium has gone three straight tournament games without scoring.
Between 10,000 and 15,000 Belgian fans attended the match in Germany.
Lukas Haraslin was named Player of the Match for his constant menace and enterprise.
Belgium had 16 shot attempts with 5 on goal, while Slovakia had 10 shot attempts with 4 on goal.
Belgium were without their preferred central defensive pairing of Jan Vertonghen and Arthur Theate.
Slovakia pressing was energetic on Belgium’s makeshift defense despite fielding two 37-year-olds in outfield positions.
Jérémy Doku played on the right in the first half and Yannick Carrasco as a left-wing back, leading to a lack of balance in the team.
From a sports betting perspective, Slovakia was +600 to win outright before the match started, while Belgium was the heavy favorite at -210.
At the final whistle, the Slovakia squad and staff danced in front of their fans as their choice of victory music, 'Freed From Desire,' boomed out.
Player ratings for Slovakia: Dubravka 7, Pekalik 7, Vavro 8, Skriniar 8, Hancko 8, Kucka 7, Lobotka 7, Duda 7, Schranz 7, Bozenik 8, Harslin 8. Subs: Strelec 6, Suslov 6, Duris 6, Obert 6.
Player ratings for Belgium: Casteels 6, Castagne 5, Faes 6, Debast 6, Carrasco 5, Mangala 5, Onana 5, Trossard 5, De Bruyne 6, Doku 5, Lukaku 5. Subs: Bakayoko 6, Tielemans 6, Openda 7, Lukebakio 6.
